newer_release.name: Runtimes 2.0.6
newer_release.body:
# Changelog

Changelog for the runtimes governed by the Polkadot Fellowship.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/).

## [2.0.6] 04.02.2026

### Changed

- Updates to latest polkadot-sdk

# Runtime info
*These runtimes were built with **rustc 1.88.0 (6b00bc388 2025-06-23)** using **[srtool v0.18.3](https://github.com/paritytech/srtool)***

To replicate the build, use the following command:
```sh
srtool build
       --root --profile production
       --package CRATE_NAME --runtime-dir PATH_TO_CRATE
       --build-opts=""
```

ai_analysis:
# Polkadot Fellows Runtimes v2.0.6 Release Analysis

## 1. Executive Summary for Non-Technical Users

### Main Improvements
This release focuses on **governance improvements**, **validator management enhancements**, and **infrastructure optimizations**. The changes primarily benefit validators, governance participants, and developers working with the Polkadot ecosystem.

### Key Benefits Users Will See
- **Better Spam Protection**: Kusama now requires higher deposits to submit governance proposals, reducing spam
- **Improved Validator Operations**: New tools for separating stake management from validator operations
- **Enhanced Asset Support**: HOLLAR token can now be used on Polkadot's People Chain for identity services
- **Better Documentation**: Clearer guides for runtime upgrades

### Actions Required
- **Kusama Governance Participants**: Proposal submission now costs 333.3 KSM instead of 33.33 KSM
- **Validators**: Can now use new "StakingOperator" proxy type for better operational security
- **No action required** for regular users and token holders

## 2. Key Changes Explained

### Security Improvements
- **Anti-Spam Measures**: Kusama governance submission deposits increased 10x (from ~33 KSM to ~333 KSM) to prevent spam proposals while keeping legitimate governance accessible
- **Validator Security**: New StakingOperator proxy type allows validators to separate their staking funds from operational keys, reducing risk if operational systems are compromised

### New Features
- **StakingOperator Proxy**: Validators can now delegate operational tasks (session key management, validator actions) while keeping control over funds
- **HOLLAR Token Support**: People Chain now supports HOLLAR token for paying identity service fees, expanding payment options

### Performance Improvements
- **Faster CI/CD**: Development infrastructure optimized to use appropriate computing resources more efficiently
- **Better Testing**: Enhanced migration testing with daily snapshots instead of constant re-downloads

## 3. Technical Summary for Developers

### Major API/Interface Changes
- **New Proxy Type**: `StakingOperator` proxy type added to both relay chains and Asset Hubs
  - Relay Chain: Can manage `set_keys`, `purge_keys`
  - Asset Hub: Can perform `validate`, `chill`, `kick` operations
- **Proxy Hierarchy**: `Staking` proxy can now add/remove `StakingOperator` proxies

### Migration Requirements
- **Kusama Governance**: Applications submitting referenda must update deposit calculations (100x increase from QUID to 100*QUID)
- **Asset Integration**: People Chain now includes `pallet-assets` for multi-asset support

### Technical Improvements
- **CI/CD Optimization**: Workflow reorganization using GitHub runners for lighter tasks, self-hosted for heavy compilation
- **Testing Infrastructure**: Migration tests now use cached daily snapshots
- **Integration Coverage**: Added Encointer to integration test matrix

## 4. Code Impact Analysis

### Most Affected System Components
1. **Governance Module** (Kusama): Parameter changes for submission deposits
2. **Proxy System** (All chains): New proxy type implementation with permission matrix
3. **People Chain**: Major addition of assets pallet and XCM integration
4. **CI/CD Infrastructure**: Comprehensive workflow optimization

### Types of Changes Made
- **Parameter Updates** (40%): Governance deposit adjustments, version bumps
- **Feature Additions** (35%): StakingOperator proxy, HOLLAR support, assets pallet
- **Infrastructure Improvements** (20%): CI/CD optimization, testing enhancements
- **Documentation** (5%): Runtime upgrade guide improvements

### Development Process Improvements
- **Better Resource Management**: CI jobs now appropriately use GitHub vs self-hosted runners
- **Enhanced Testing**: Daily snapshot caching reduces test setup time
- **Improved Documentation**: Comprehensive runtime upgrade guide added

---

**Note**: This release maintains backward compatibility for regular users while introducing opt-in improvements for validators and governance participants. The changes reflect the ecosystem's maturation with better operational security and spam prevention measures.

pr_details.title: Update Kusama submission deposit as per ref#558
pr_details.author: olanod
pr_details.body:
A recent [WFC](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/558) passed to adjust submission deposit to prevent spams specially on the WFC track. 

A missing part of the WFC is to add a new extrinsic to the PolkadotSDK to "collect submission deposits", a permissionless extrinsic that would enable transferring the reserved deposit of failed or timed out referenda to a well-known account as the deposits are blocked forever in the user's account, kind of like a limbo state.

pr_details.title: Improve runtime upgrade docs
pr_details.author: skunert
pr_details.body:
In the README we already have the short overview of the steps to apply a runtime upgrade.

In addition, there is this nice [doc](https://hackmd.io/_VZG98ZgTCSllp4blnO-6w?view) by @seadanda floating around. It contains a bit more context and testing instructions. Instead of  sending the hackmd around, it should be part of the repo.

Mostly I left the contents as they were but with a few changes to make it more concise:
- Added WASM blob upload step
- Merged Kusama and Polkadot flow (with notes when different steps needed)


- [x] Does not require a CHANGELOG entry

pr_details.title: Use GH runners for small jobs + disable ecosystem tests
pr_details.author: bkchr
pr_details.body:
This pull request changes the CI pipeline to use GH runners for small jobs to use the big machines for the heavier jobs. Also this disables the ecosystem tests because they are taking right now multiple hours. Alexanxdre will work on fixing them.

pr_details.title: Add `StakingOperator` proxy type and allow `Staking` proxy to add/remove a `StakingOperator`
pr_details.author: sigurpol
pr_details.body:
## 📝 Summary
Introduce `StakingOperator` proxy type for Polkadot and Kusama AssetHub and RelayChain  to enable separation between stake providers and node operators: the `StakingOperator` proxy types  allows stake providers to delegate operational tasks while retaining control over bonding, unbonding, nominations, and reward destinations.

##  StakingOperator

Allowed operations:
- Asset Hub: validate, chill, kick
- Relay Chain: set_keys, purge_keys

## Staking vs StakingOperator

- The `Staking` proxy is a superset of `StakingOperator`. 
- Staking proxy can add / remove Staking Operator proxies
  - ... but staking proxy can't add other kind of proxies.

## Limitation: Pure proxy stashes are not supported

A pure proxy stash cannot use `StakingOperator` because it has no private key to set up the required Relay Chain proxy relationship. This will be resolved once  session key management is available through Asset Hub (see https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/issues/8806)
                                                                                                                                                         
## ⚠️ NOTE

This approach results in a sub-optimal user experience because we are requiring the setup of proxy relationships on both AssetHub and RelayChain. This constraint arises from the necessity for validators to manage session keys directly on RelayChain. Once we enable them to manage keys solely through AssetHub, we can eliminate the StakingOperator proxy on RelayChain.

Related issue: https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/issues/10483

pr_details.title: check-migrations: Cache & Download snapshot only once per day
pr_details.author: bkchr
pr_details.body:
Before we always redownloaded the snapshot every time running the job. Now the snapshots are generated 1am every day and then used from there.

pr_details.title: Allow HOLLAR to be reserved transferred to People Chain from Hydration
pr_details.author: franciscoaguirre
pr_details.body:
We want to use HOLLAR in People Chain. We need to get it from Hydration as a reserve.
